assessments.status_rationale: Today’s bullets do not mention BLS publishing (or scheduling) the delayed January 2026 Employment Situation report. Deadline is 2026-02-20, so it remains unresolved.
No item indicates a White House/USTR joint statement or fact sheet on a U.S.-India trade framework with explicit tariff-rate changes. Deadline is 2026-03-31.

A CNBC item references 'Powell and Cook investigations' in the context of Senate Banking Democrats, but there is no clear public confirmation by DOJ or DOJ OIG of a review/inquiry/investigation explicitly naming Jerome Powell and the Federal Reserve. Deadline is 2026-03-31.
No evidence in today’s bullets that SpaceX announced a named Starlink product/feature using xAI models (e.g., Grok) with a public product page or press release. Deadline is 2026-06-30.
No news bullet indicates an executive order/presidential memorandum establishing or directing creation of a U.S. critical-mineral reserve/stockpile program. Deadline is 2026-04-30.

Today’s items mention heightened U.S.-Iran tensions (e.g., a drone being shot down) but do not report a publicly acknowledged direct meeting between U.S. and Iranian officials confirmed by either government. Deadline is 2026-03-31.
No Federal Register notice about initiating a new offshore wind lease sale process (Call for Information/Nominations or Proposed Sale Notice) appears in today’s bullets. Deadline is 2026-09-30.
No announcement is listed regarding DHS awarding (or announcing) a ≥$50M contract for ICE/HSI/ERO body-worn cameras or evidence-management services. Deadline is 2026-05-31.
None of the bullets show two or more major API-key platforms publishing guidance explicitly referencing the 'Moltbook' breach/exposure and advising key rotation. Deadline is 2026-03-15.
